reason: TETRAHEDRON DIAGRAM DOES NOT APPEAR IN THE BLM MODEL: The BLM paper (Draft.tex line 556) explicitly states: 'This diagram does not actually appear in our theory because our lines are oriented and each vertex has either all incoming or all outgoing lines.' The tetrahedron diagram is used only as a pedagogical exercise. The first non-melonic diagram that actually appears is the 9j/cube diagram (lines 579-622), and even that vanishes for odd j (line 610). The actual first non-vanishing non-melonic diagram is the 12j cube (lines 612-622), which has 8 vertices (not 4) and scales as N^4 * {12j} ~ j * (log j / j). Using the tetrahedron as the proxy for non-melonic diagrams in the q-deformed case is misleading because: (1) it does not appear in the model, (2) the actual non-melonic diagrams involve more complicated symbols (12j, not 6j), and (3) the scaling analysis is completely different for multi-vertex diagrams where multiple 6j-like factors may appear with different q-dependent behaviors.
